# Copilot Instructions for AIU-Trips-And-Events

## Project Overview
This is a university event and trips management system designed to manage the entire activities process through a web application. The system handles university events and trips, facilitating the complete workflow from planning to execution.

## Project Purpose
- Manage university events and trips
- Streamline the activities process
- Provide a comprehensive web-based solution for university activity management

## Coding Standards and Best Practices

### General Guidelines
- Write clear, maintainable, and well-documented code
- Follow consistent naming conventions across the codebase
- Prioritize code readability and simplicity
- Write meaningful commit messages that describe the changes

### Code Style
- Use descriptive variable and function names
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility
- Add comments for complex logic or business rules
- Maintain consistent indentation and formatting

### Documentation
- Document all public APIs and complex functions
- Keep README.md up to date with setup and usage instructions
- Add inline comments for non-obvious code sections
- Update documentation when making functional changes

## Architecture Principles
- Follow modular design patterns
- Separate concerns (business logic, data access, presentation)
- Ensure scalability and maintainability
- Implement proper error handling and validation

## Testing Guidelines
- Write tests for new features and bug fixes
- Maintain good test coverage
- Test edge cases and error conditions
- Keep tests isolated and independent

## Security Considerations
- Validate all user inputs
- Implement proper authentication and authorization
- Protect sensitive data
- Follow security best practices for web applications

## Contribution Workflow
- Create feature branches for new development
- Write clear pull request descriptions
- Review code before merging
- Ensure all tests pass before merging changes
